name: places/ChIJSxyuyaJYwokRnrldro_G1Ps
formattedAddress: 1211 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1211 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10128-0508, USA

editorialSummary.text: Supermarket chain stocking meats, seafood & baked goods along with name-brand dry goods.

originalText.text: They offer a very large hot food bar at a very reasonable price per pound. The quality is more than equal to the price. Some of the food bar CHOICES they offer, you might only expect to see in a fine dining restaurant, and that relates to the soups too. Today I tried from their baked goods offerings section, a chocolate cookie offered by the pound. The photograph of the chocolate cookie I have posted here did not have an adequate amount of chocolate flavor to it for me.

text.text: They offer a very large hot food bar at a very reasonable price per pound. The quality is more than equal to the price. Some of the food bar CHOICES they offer, you might only expect to see in a fine dining restaurant, and that relates to the soups too. The photograph of the chocolate cookie I have posted here did not have an adequate amount of chocolate flavor to it for me.

originalText.text:
Got breakfast at 7:50 from salad bar.  At cash register they have a slide out item that hurts to walk into.  Feels like they move it out on purpose, at least for me.  They should not mind selling the breakfast bar in the morning despite all their work, the quick checkout gets closed.

The way I got startled the register clerk made some threatening face.  It is unacceptable to slide out an obstacle at a space where customers and unloading staff are passing through at the same time and having to move fast.

Still it is proper to have plastic knives and forks ready.  You can't afford Christmas ‚õÑüéÅ: you can't afford ChristmasüéÑ.

Hopping to see the breakfast ü•ì still.  Many thanks to the chef.

originalText.text: Half the staff seem to either hate working there. I'm a daily customer since I live nearby but the constant attitude and trying to confront me like I'm a thief when me and my family are daily customers is disgusting. Brooklyn Market is down the street and their staff is always polite and friendly. I've never had an issue with their staff. Their staff smiles and tells you to have a good day. That's how it was when I used to work in supermarkets. I spend most of money there now. I always feel defeated having to shop at this Morton Williams specifically.

originalText.text: I have a love hate relationship with this Morton Williams. They‚Äôre wildly overpriced and the labeling system is a complete mess. I can think of at least a dozen times now where the price will say one thing on the shelf, and then scan differently at the cashier. So you HAVE to watch when the cashier scans your items closely or you‚Äôll end up paying a lot more than what you were expecting. Items are also often double scanned. The staff are very nice..but many of them are just fairly incompetent. I think the management here is ultimately the one responsible for the mess of this store. It‚Äôs too bad, because I do actually like the items they carry.

originalText.text: DO NOT SHOP HERE. My coworkers and I have all gotten sick from eating here. Yesterday I was in the store and a baby rat ran right underneath me. I tried to inform the manager about it but she seemed very rude and uninterested about the issue. Will not go back here, ever!
